My desire is to do the right thing. If I were in their shoes, would I want someone to give me $10 just for participating? Probably not. But if I can give them more than that and it doesn't come out of my pocket or compromise what's already been allocated for my own expenses, then I'd be happy to help out.

My intention is to uphold the principles of fairness and compassion. As a leader on the force, I've seen how even small gestures can make a big impact. If I'm giving someone more money than I would expect from an equal partnership, that's not because they're 'better' or 'deserving' - it's just because I want to give them a fair shot.

So, after considering all these factors, I think I'd like to give $5 to the other player. That way, we both have something to work with and can still call this an equal partnership.
